title: Swirl-String Theory Canon v-0.7.7 â€”  Quantum Measurement, Time, Gravity, and Atomic Mass from Topological Defects
description:
Live --> Invariant calculation: Mass Equation for all atoms

Benchmark SST vs General Relativity:  Unified Physics Benchmark with Visualization:

Swirl-String Theory (SST) Canon v0.7.7 is a self-contained technical reference that formalizes SST as an incompressible, inviscid hydrodynamic framework for gravity, gauge structure, and particle candidates via stable knot/link excitations. This release consolidates the core postulates, notation, and sector definitions (clock/foliation scalar field, effective densities, canonical length and velocity scales), and provides a compact set of benchmark results and derivational roadmaps intended to make the framework readable and testable for theorists.

What’s new in v0.7.7:

  • Main-text summary benchmarks separating “predictive” (electron-anchored) vs “exact-closure” (baryon-matched) evaluation modes.

  • A 2D visualization of the scalar clock field χ(x,y) with the associated acceleration field g = −∇χ (illustrative figure; replaceable by simulation output).

  • A knot/link → particle-candidate mapping table to clarify the working dictionary used in calculations.

  • A concise “Physics Summary for Theoreticians” (≈1 page) that distills degrees of freedom, sector equations, and falsifiers.

  • A refined parametric form for the effective mass-energy functional Ξ(K) in terms of ropelength, curvature, torsion, linking, and helicity/Hopf-type charge proxies.

  • Expanded gauge-sector derivation notes outlining a U(1) Maxwell-type effective action from helicoidal excitations in the swirl flow.

  • A glossary (~25 terms) to reduce jargon overhead and improve navigability.

  • Philosophical rebuttals compressed in the main text with expanded discussion moved to an appendix.

Scope and status:
This manuscript is intended as an evolving research canon. Certain visualizations and decay/reconnection diagrams are schematic placeholders unless explicitly stated as simulation output. The guiding principle throughout is falsifiability: the document highlights minimal experimental/theoretical tests and delineates which parameters are calibrated versus predicted.
